name: Temple
blurb: Locus of divine kingship and human silence; judgment discourse ends in doxological hush.

name: Selah
blurb: Liturgical pause or interlude; signals meditation or musical lift.

name: Habakkuk
blurb: Prophet whose name likely means “embrace” or “wrestle,” mirroring his dialog with God over justice. Habakkuk functions as a temple-prophet/poet, voicing complaint, waiting at the watchpost, and conclu
searchText: habakkuk person prophet prophet whose name likely means “embrace” or “wrestle,” mirroring his dialog with god over justice. habakkuk functions as a temple-prophet/poet, voicing complaint, waiting at the watchpost, and concluding with a psalm that models trust.

name: Priests/Temple musicians
blurb: Liturgical personnel implied by the musical notations and dedication to the choirmaster; they situate Habakkuk’s prayer within temple worship.

name: Arrows
blurb: Instruments of divine judgment; flash like lightning.

name: Faith as resilience
blurb: Habakkuk’s model: waiting, trembling, trusting—faithfulness over the long delay.

name: Arrows/Spear of light
blurb: Your bow is bared; arrows flash like lightning; spears glitter as celestial bodies halt.
searchText: arrows/spear of light figure theophany-weapon your bow is bared; arrows flash like lightning; spears glitter as celestial bodies halt.

name: Violence as boomerang
blurb: Measure-for-measure justice: the violence and shame you inflicted returns upon your own head.
searchText: violence as boomerang figure judicial-reversal measure-for-measure justice: the violence and shame you inflicted returns upon your own head.

name: The Holy One
blurb: Divine title emphasizing moral purity and covenant reliability; frames the paradox of using a wicked nation without endorsing wickedness.
searchText: the holy one divine title divine title emphasizing moral purity and covenant reliability; frames the paradox of using a wicked nation without endorsing wickedness.

name: Drunkeners
blurb: Agents who shame neighbors with drink to gaze on nakedness; their own disgrace is decreed.
searchText: drunkeners group vice-group agents who shame neighbors with drink to gaze on nakedness; their own disgrace is decreed.

name: Idol-makers
blurb: Craftsmen and sponsors of mute idols, indicting religion in service of power.

name: Proud
blurb: The swollen soul that is not upright; archetype of imperial arrogance.
searchText: proud group ethical-group the swollen soul that is not upright; archetype of imperial arrogance.

name: Righteous
blurb: Those who live by faith/faithfulness amid confusion and delay.
searchText: righteous group ethical-group those who live by faith/faithfulness amid confusion and delay.

name: Victim nations
blurb: Peoples plundered by the Chaldeans; their taunt becomes judicial testimony.

name: Violent city builders
blurb: Those who erect empires with blood; their labor fuels the fire of divine judgment.

name: Debtors
blurb: Those crushed by predatory lending and conquest-tribute; in Habakkuk’s woes, their cry becomes the instrument of reversal.
searchText: debtors person economically-oppressed those crushed by predatory lending and conquest-tribute; in habakkuk’s woes, their cry becomes the instrument of reversal.

name: Judah’s unjust judges
blurb: Judicial actors in Judah whose perversion of justice—Torah paralyzed, the wicked hemming in the righteous—prompts Habakkuk’s first complaint.
searchText: judah’s unjust judges person officials judicial actors in judah whose perversion of justice—torah paralyzed, the wicked hemming in the righteous—prompts habakkuk’s first complaint.

name: Oppressors/Creditors
blurb: Predators who exact usury and plunder. Their gain becomes their downfall as the nations they exploited rise to taunt them.
searchText: oppressors/creditors person economic-agents predators who exact usury and plunder. their gain becomes their downfall as the nations they exploited rise to taunt them.

name: Scribes/Watchmen
blurb: Figures who stand on the rampart and inscribe revelation. They embody vigilance and faithful transmission: write the vision plainly so runners can carry it.
searchText: scribes/watchmen person office figures who stand on the rampart and inscribe revelation. they embody vigilance and faithful transmission: write the vision plainly so runners can carry it.

name: The Choirmaster
blurb: Director of temple performance; the prayer’s liturgical setting underscores communal reception and catechesis.

name: Chariots of salvation
blurb: Divine mobility metaphor: God rides victorious for salvation.

name: Curtains of Midian
blurb: Nomadic dwellings quake; motif of distant witnesses to YHWH’s advance.

name: Debt/Usury
blurb: Predatory lending practices condemned by wisdom and law traditions.

name: Delay/appointed time
blurb: The vision hastens to the end; apparent delay tests fidelity without nullifying promise.

name: Fields
blurb: Fields yield no food—macro sign of covenant curse imagery reversed by faith.

name: Fig tree
blurb: Staple of prosperity; its failure dramatizes total economic collapse.

name: Flocks

name: Foundation built on blood
blurb: City-making through oppression; destined for fire.

name: Herds

name: High places

name: Idol
blurb: Crafted god incapable of speech; indicts human attempts to control the divine.

name: Joy amid ruin
blurb: Practiced rejoicing independent of circumstances; theological resilience.

name: Olive
blurb: Olive-crop failure cuts deep into food, light, and wealth.

name: Shame-drinking
blurb: Instrumentalized intoxication to exploit others; reversed in the cup of wrath.

name: Shigionoth
blurb: Rare term marking a passionate, possibly irregular rhythmic prayer-song.

name: Siege apparatus

name: Silence before the LORD

name: Spear
blurb: Glittering weapon aligned with cosmic portents.

blurb: Stone that cannot teach versus the speaking God; satire of idolatry.

name: Vine

blurb: Processional appearance from Teman/Paran; cosmic upheaval attends the Warrior who goes forth for salvation of his anointed.
